If she was putting it that way, then there was no reason to refuse.

We listened to {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s story in silence.

………

……

…

It was a personal story.

It summed up {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s long life as a princess of a great nation.

The guilt she felt towards Milim, the fear she felt towards {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|.

Her resentment towards Leon and its sublimation.

Listening to {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s story, I almost felt guilty for having killed Clayman.

After all, the Clayman in {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s story was a kind and caring man.

I could tell from {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s tone of voice that he was loved by his friends.

However, he had been distorted by his role as {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|, and in the end, he was used by Lieutenant {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|. As a result, he became the cause of many misfortunes, and was abandoned by {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| lords, particularly {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|.

And I was the one who had killed Clayman.

“About Clayman, well…”

“Oh, there is no need to apologize. It was I who devised the plan, and {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|-dono was just better than I was. After all, this is a world of survival of the fittest, and there is no need to show mercy to the loser.”

That was also true.

In the first place, Clayman had been completely evil from our point of view, and if I hadn’t eliminated him, we would have suffered a great deal. Even if you say that there was another side to him, it can only be said to be true.

However, there were some things that I should think about regarding the fact that he was probably being manipulated, and I might have even developed some sympathy for him in an unorthodox way.

That’s why I decided to tell {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| something that I had been holding back, wondering whether I should tell her or not.

“Actually, I wanted to talk to you about {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|—”

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| was another one of the {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| members who had been giving us trouble. She wasn’t as bad as Clayman or {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|, but that didn’t change the fact that she had been a nasty enemy.

But now that we have an agreement, we were no longer enemies. It was natural for us to help her as an ally, if not as a friend.

That’s why I rescued {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| when she was about to be killed by Jahil, but she had been seriously injured while protecting {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|. She was still resting in her hospital room, but {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|-san was helping her.

«‘Isolation’ of the “information particles” that constituted Clayman’s ‘heart’ has been completed. Would you like to combine them together to make up for {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s missing components?»

When I was asked this question, I agreed to do so.

Looking back on it, I had swallowed Clayman’s end whole. I thought I had absorbed all of him as energy, but it seems that the residue had been placed in ‘Isolation.’

I didn’t want to leave such a thing behind, and I thought Clayman would be happier to return to his friends rather than to remain in my body.

Perhaps, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|-san could have revived Clayman completely. It seemed to me that the success rate would have been reasonably high if the Emulated Soul had been inhabited by the information particle residue and given a temporary body.

But I never heard the answer.

Clayman was dead.

That is why I wanted to help him as a part of {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| from now on.

This was completely my own decision and ego, and I had not been sure if I should tell {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| and the others. But now, I thought I should tell them.

“Is that so…that kid, with {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|…thank you.”

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| muttered and smiled wistfully.

*

I thought I was just doing it for my own self-satisfaction, but I’m glad {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| seemed to be happy too.

It would have been better if the conversation had ended there—

“By the way, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|-kun, I’ve been listening to you, and I think you’re being too selfish.”

“Indeed…even the Divine Ancestor didn’t do such a crazy thing as collecting the residues of the dead and transplanting them into others!”

I forgot these guys were here.

It would have been better if I had just ignored them, but I took the bait.

“When did you guys become such good friends?”

“Huh? We don’t really get along. It’s not bad though.”

“Yeah, that’s right! From my point of view, I’d say you’re the one who’s incomprehensible when you just casually chat with the Lord of Darkness, who is synonymous with fear!”

It doesn’t matter even if you say something like that, you know?

After all, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| was a little more open-minded than I initially thought.

He didn’t get angry over trivial things, so as long as you kept in mind the things you should pay attention to, he was easier to get along with than you might think.

“I knew {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|-kun was strange. Even more so than what El-chan told me. To begin with, I thought {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| Crimson there was a horrible {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| who became a {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| after killing my brother Jahil in seconds. If it were that easy to get along with him, no one would have any trouble, right?”

I didn’t have the chance to interrupt her as she rambled on.

Seeing us like that, the person in question spoke with a laugh.

“I think it’s quite brazen of you to say that in front of me.”

Ah, Silvia-san seems to have taken a liking to {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|.

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| has a tendency to give respect to those who don’t fear him. This seemed like a nice start to a good relationship for the future.

In any case, I thought I had gotten away from the subject, but that was not the case.

“So, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|. What did you do with the Clayman residue?”

Unfortunately, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| hadn’t forgotten, so I had no choice but to explain.

“No, no, it just sort of happened, you know? It really was just a coincidence when I was saving them from Jahil’s attack—”

I just let it slip out of my mouth.

It’s a little sad that I had gotten used to this, but telling the truth was out of the question. I had no intention of revealing my abilities, and if the situation arose, I intended to keep silent.

“That’s suspicious…are you hiding something?”

“Talk to him more. He always keeps his mouth shut about the important things.”

“Sh-Shut up, you guys! There’s a lot of things I don’t understand, and I don’t know why it happened this time either!”

Actually, it was {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|-san who did it, right?

I don’t know anything about it.

So, I don’t want others to get involved in it either…

Rather, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| and Silvia-san had never met before, yet somehow, they were in perfect harmony. Today was the first time we had met too, but Silvia-san looked just like El-tan, so it didn’t feel like it was the first time.

And so, unexpectedly, the late-night secret meeting became friendly and lively.

Following the flow of the conversation, Silvia-san broke the ice.

“By the way. {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|-san, I wasn’t sure if I should ask this, but I was wondering if you could tell me about your friends?”

There was no mockery in her manner, but rather an air of determination.

“Eh?”

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|, who responded, was also puzzled to see Silvia-san like that.

But then, as if remembering something, she opened her mouth.

“I have an idea of what you want to ask me, so it’s fine. Also, you don’t have to address me with ‘san,’ so you can just drop the honorifics.”

“Thank you. Then you can call me Silvia as well. Now, I know it may seem sudden, but—”

“It’s about Laplace, right?”

“Yeah. You heard about it?”

“Yes. Laplace was reacting to your voice when you called him {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|. {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|…if the {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| from the Sorcerer’s Dynasty is Laplace’s real name, then I’ve got a hell of a person on my side…”

Their conversation continued.

I had no idea what they were talking about, but they seemed to be talking about Laplace’s true identity.

—Or rather…

“Eh? Laplace is an ex-Chosen {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|?!”

“Yes, that’s right. And by the way, he’s my husband, and El-chan’s papa.”

“…Seriously?”

“Dead serious.”

I looked at {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| in astonishment, and she nodded back calmly.

She seemed to have already sorted things out in her mind.

And the same could be said for Silvia-san, I guess.

It must have been a long time ago, but she didn’t show any sign of resentment towards {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|, even though she should have resented her more for the fact that her husband, who she thought was dead, had been turned into an {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|.

“I’m sorry. I don’t blame you for hating me, but I’m still glad that I met Laplace.”

“I’m happy to hear that, too. It makes me believe that he didn’t change his character even after he died. The way he defended you at the end made me realize that the man I loved is gone—”

According to Silvia-san, Laplace could have escaped if he had wanted to. But he didn’t do so, perhaps because he was proud to be a member of the {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|.

Well, there was no way of knowing the truth now…

“Well, that’s not necessarily true.”

I didn’t mean to comfort her, but those words came out of my mouth.

It was selfish of me, but I couldn’t give up hope.

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|-san had told me that the chances of them being alive were not zero. That’s why I decided to believe that {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| and Laplace were still alive.

In the first place, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| had always given me a lot of trouble, but as he was also Japanese, and a disciple of Shizu-san, I expected to be more shocked at his death.

The reason why I did not feel sad was because I suspected that his death was a lie.

No, it’s true that he had disappeared right before my eyes without a trace, but I couldn’t trust him.

Because I had been deceived by him many times.

That’s why he’s alive.

As long as I thought that, there was no need to be sad.

“You’re right. The boss is really stubborn.”

“Yeah. {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| has been alive all this time and hasn’t even contacted me, so he really is a no-good person. He just reincarnated as an {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| and lost his memory, leaving me alone. It’s no use worrying about such a no-good guy, so I’ll change my mindset!”

Apparently, my words were not in vain.

I was worried that my words might have been inappropriate, but if I could lighten {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s and Silvia-san’s feelings even a little, then I had done a good job.

And so, the late-night conversations continued.

Overcoming today’s sorrows to win tomorrow’s battles.

  1. Interlude
    The Army of Justice

When {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| returned to the Heavenly Star Palace, Michael had just returned.

“Looks like you got beat up pretty bad.”

“Ah. Something unexpected happened. I went out to purge the defector Obera, but my ‘Castle Guard’ didn’t work.”

“What? I didn’t have a problem—”

“That’s probably why. These powers are one at their core. Since you’ve set your loyalists as phantoms, I’m guessing that there’s no one who knows about me.”

“But there’s me?”

“{:this.app.capitalCase(this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term], true):}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|, that’s against the basic principles of the skill. It’s natural for your allegiance to be nullified.”

The two reported each other’s situation as if they were having a casual conversation.

It was a surprise to {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| that Michael could not use the Castle Guard. However, because he was able to figure it out without sustaining serious damage, it was okay.

What he was more concerned about was what Obera, the traitor, would do and how it would end.

“So, what happened with Obera?”

“Unfortunately, she escaped. Obera’s subordinates were admirably loyal and successfully protected her from the rest.”

Michael stated matter-of-factly that it was a shame to have lost such valuable assets. Even though he had killed them all himself, his attitude was like that of someone else.

“The soldiers under Obera’s command were excellent. It’s a shame to have lost such a force.”

Even {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s reply was so indifferent that it was hard to believe that it came from the heart.

In fact, Obera’s subordinates were loyal only to Obera and had no relation to {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|. That is why he did not consider this a great loss to him. It would not affect the Castle Guard in any way, so he decided that it was not a problem.

This callousness was the reason why {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| was not well-liked. However, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| did not care about this and continued his rationalism to the utmost.

It was different in the past, but there was no trace of that time left in the present {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|.

“Now then—”

Michael changed the subject.

He looked at the newcomers, Leon and Jahil, and confirmed that their forces had decreased since before the battle. He nodded his head and began to speak.

“I think we need a chain of command for our forces. {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|, since you are the Supreme Commander, I think we should consider who should be placed under you, what do you think?”

When asked, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| nodded with a “Hmm.”

“Right. Now that we’ve talked to the last person we were negotiating with, we should decide on what to do before we start the full-scale invasion.”

Thus, once again, the main members of the Celestial Realm, excluding Zelanus’ forces, gathered in the audience hall.

*

First, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| presented the results of the current operation.

Michael nodded in agreement, but since he had already heard the story, this was just a formal exchange for {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|.

“I see, so Oria was killed in action.”

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| spoke absent-mindedly. In truth, she had been eaten by Vega, but such an explanation was omitted.

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| had never really known her, but she was still a friend. He closed his eyes and prayed for Oria’s soul, thinking that he should be allowed to mourn for her.

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| was followed by Pico, Gracia, and Mai, while the rest of them kept blank faces. No one seemed to wonder about the tenuous relationship, and the meeting began without further discussion.

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| took over as the moderator of the meeting.

Michael, not wanting to interfere, remained silent and watched the proceedings.

The topic of the meeting was the appointment of positions.

The purpose was to clarify the hierarchy so as not to interfere with the full-scale invasion.

Vega was the only one with an ambitious look in his eyes, while the others were indifferent. {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|, for his part, seemed blatantly unmotivated and shrunk back to avoid being forced to take any responsibility.

Under such circumstances, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s announcement began.

There was Michael as Supreme Leader.

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| himself was named Commander-in-Chief and Chief Executive Officer.

Velzard was the advisor.

The decision was made to leave her free to roam, as she alone would be a fetter to block {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s movements.

Of the remaining people, only nine were strong enough to be commanders, most notably Zalario.

No, there was one more.

The last one, who was not here, was an old acquaintance and friend of {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s.

Including him, there were ten of them.

Normally, a commander would need to have a tactical mindset, but on a battlefield where individual strength was important, strength was all that mattered. {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s idea was that as long as the hierarchy was set, the rest could be left to the discretion of the commander.

This was completely wrong, but it had worked so far. So, without any hesitation, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| set the hierarchy of strength.

The strongest, along with himself, was the old friend who was not here. He was followed by Zalario and Jahil.

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| decided to appoint these three as the new “Three Phantom Commanders.”

“First of all, we will establish the new “Three Star Commanders” to replace the position of “Three Phantom Commanders.” As generals of Veldanava-sama, I want you to exert your power to the fullest.”

The reason for the name change was that there were two people other than the phantoms.

The star, of course, referred to the “{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|.” It was a title intended for one to serve as a general with the purpose of reviving Veldanava.

“Cornu is dead, and Obera has betrayed us. In place of these two, I will appoint Jahil. The other one is expected to enter the war soon and will be appointed at that time.”

As soon as he announced this, there was a murmur of discontent.

It was Vega.

“Hey now, you’re appointing some random bastard to be a supreme general of the Heavenly Army instead of me? That doesn’t make any sense!”

This time, Vega, empowered by eating Oria, was getting carried away again. He was a very unfortunate man who appeared to have lost the concept of remorse.

The only person who could handle Vega well was {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|, but {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| didn’t care.

“Shut up. My decision is final. If you make another comment, I’ll have you executed. Are you prepared for that?”

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| didn’t have any idea how to utilize human resources.

He possessed a very clear mindset that all that mattered was whether someone was useful or not. Anyone who was not useful would be discarded.

That is why he was not well-liked, and {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| did not care about that. Next time, if Vega disobeyed him, he would seriously dispose of him.

Vega, with his superior survival instincts, could sense this.

The Vega who had been feeling all-powerful after his growth, found {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s strength to be on a different level. He knew that he was not yet a match for {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|, so he had no choice but to retreat quietly.

“Damn, I’m sorry. I wanted you to think more highly of me, so I interrupted you…”

He made up for the mistake and pushed down his dissatisfaction.

However, he smiled once he heard {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s next comment.

“Don’t be so rotten about it. I think highly of you as well. That’s why I’m giving you the lead position of the ‘Seven Angels of Death.’”

The “Seven Angels of Death” was also the name of the group that was supposed to consist of the ultimate skill holders of the angelic lineage. But alas, there were not enough of them. {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|, who did not care about details, designated the remaining main force as the “Seven Angels” in order to make up the numbers.

Originally, he had planned to appoint {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| and Obera as part of the “Seven Angels,” and Vega was going to be included as one of the “Four Star Commanders.”

Mai and Oria were going to be assigned as auxiliaries, to serve as support. Unfortunately, from the very beginning, the plan had been drastically modified.

In any case, he decided to assign Zalario, Jahil, and one more person, as the “Three Star Commanders.” The “Seven Angels” consisted of Leon, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|, Pico, Gracia, Arios and Mai Furuki, with Vega at the top.

*

Now, the “Three Star Admirals” were to command their respective corps, while the “Seven Angels” were to engage in single and multi-personal operations.

And then, the main strategy was discussed.

“Now that we have Leon amongst our ranks, it can be said that we have broken one of the {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| lords forces. This means that we have one less point to attack.”

At {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s words, Mai projected a miniature version of the Cardinal World and lit five points of light on the ground. One of them, the white dot on the continent controlled by Leon, disappeared.

Only four spots remained.

But then, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| pointed to a point.

Mai changed the color of the spot from white to red.

“We don’t need this place either. My friend has promised to help me, rather than {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|.”

The extinguished spot of light displayed the far west, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s territory.

“Are you saying that {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| has switched sides?”

It was Leon who asked that question.

The one who nodded in agreement was the third member of the “Three Star Commanders.” He was a slender man with an exceptionally large physique.

“I have arrived, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|. You’ve done a bold thing, releasing me from the seal.”

The man was not {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|.

His long, shaggy hair was green. It was not the same as {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s dull blue hair. His eyes shined like jade, which was also different from the blue-eyed {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|.

However, they were vaguely similar in appearance.

The man’s “name” was Fenn.

He was the younger brother of {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|, the “{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|,” and was known as the “Mad Fist” titan who had been sealed away by Veldanava during a rampage in ancient times.

The first to react to the sight of Fenn was {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|, who was normally laid-back.

“It can’t be, you released the Gleipnir that was binding Fenn?! Even though {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| has been so vigilant, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|, what the hell are you thinking?!”

And, quite unusually, he questioned {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|.

He was still surprised, and his tone had become rough.

“Hmph, don’t worry. Fenn and I are friends. Our interests are aligned, and—”

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| insisted that Fenn’s abilities were tremendous.

Fenn’s magicules, which he was not trying to conceal, were leaking out as a supreme energy that overwhelmed the others. In terms of existence value, it exceeded sixty million, and was so vast that it could be said to rival the True Dragons.

However, there were other people besides {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| who were uncomfortable with Fenn.

“Damn, an evil deity sealed away in ancient times. He’s the kind of tyrant that even I wouldn’t want to deal with, let alone the Divine Ancestor!”

Jahil spat viciously.

He did not know the man directly but had heard about him from the Divine Ancestor.

According to him, he was an evil deity who had been sealed by Veldanava for his destructive acts.

In Jahil’s mind, he was the second most evil incarnation after the “World-destroying Dragon” Ivarage.

That legend was now standing in front of him. Faced with this fact, Jahil was disgusted to the point of nausea.

But Fenn didn’t care.

Smiling, he put his arm around Jahil’s shoulders and whispered in his ear.

“Hey now, we’re all friends, right? Let’s get along. I heard about it. Like you, I was appointed as one of the ‘Three Star Commanders.’ Unlike the rest of those small fry, you’ve got something to offer. You’re more than qualified to be my servant.”

It was a statement that completely disrespected Jahil.

Jahil shuddered in humiliation.

For Jahil, who believed that he deserved to reign as the emperor, it was unthinkable to be looked down upon.

But he could not complain.

He could feel the desperate pressure of the arm around his shoulder.

A cold sweat broke out on Jahil’s forehead, and he sat back in his chair.

“Hmph! I forgive you for now. I don’t intend to end up like this either, but I’ll leave things alone for now.”

And with that, he agreed to work for Fenn.

Now that that was out of the way, they were wondering about the reaction of the remaining Zalario, but he didn’t seem to have any intention of fighting in the first place. This was not just because he was under the control of the Ultimate Dominion, but also because Zalario, as a warrior, understood his own strength.

Whether he could win or not could only be seen in actual combat. However, an all-out battle would cause enormous damage to both sides and would undoubtedly affect the future of the war.

It would be pointless, to say the least.

That is why Zalario decided to end the situation by giving in himself.

Thus, Fenn was appointed as the leader of the “Three Star Commanders.”

With all the actors in place, all eyes turned once again to the miniature Cardinal World.

“So, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|. What do you mean that {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s not a problem? I understand that Fenn-dono has joined our ranks, but that’s not the end of the matter.”

Fenn replied to Jahil with a smirk.

“Hey now, that’s just sad. Are you underestimating my abilities? If you know me, then you should understand, right? {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| is certainly my big brother, but I’m more powerful than him.”

Jahil replied bitterly to Fenn.

“I don’t need that kind of boasting. If you really have no problem with it, just show me the results.”

Jahil was arrogant.

Even though he recognized Fenn’s ability, he did not intend to give up his pride as an emperor to follow him.

Fenn seemed to like Jahil and smirked at him.

“Even though you know me, you still have that attitude. That’s fine, I’ll live up to your expectations.”

Fenn smiled happily.

He hadn’t had a chance to talk to anyone ever since he had been sealed away in Veldanava so long ago. Despite this, scenes of the world had still been flowing into his mind as if he were dreaming.

This was because he was connected to his brother, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|, and his other brother, deep in his soul.

That is why he was aware of the world situation to a certain extent. He understood that they were at the verge of the beginning of the age of civil war, and that this was an environment where he could be violent.

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| was the only one who had visited Fenn when he was sealed up.

As for {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|, he had only been taking care of Fenn because Veldanava entrusted him to do so. At some point, they became friends, exchanging small talk and consulting each other.

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| had no relatives to talk to because he was the leader.

Fenn, too, had come to realize that solitude was lonely after being sealed for so long.

In a sense, it was inevitable that they had come to trust each other.

And now, Fenn had been given a place to play, and a friend to show off his power.

There was no reason for Fenn not to be excited.

It wasn’t not that Fenn was less violent than he used to be, it’s just that he had learned to value his friends more.

Fenn was more than happy to have friends. That is why he was grateful to {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| from the bottom of his heart.

*

Fenn had announced that he would take care of {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|, but {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| was still not satisfied with this.

“Wait, wait, wait! Hey, are you seriously okay with this, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|? If we let Fenn go, won’t we lose the reason why {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| is guarding the Heaven’s Tower?”

The Heaven’s Tower was the stairway to the Heavenly Star Palace. Those who did not have the key to open the main gates had no way to enter the Heavenly Star Palace except through the Heaven’s Tower.

It was {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| who guarded it, and his reason for doing so was to keep Fenn from being unleashed upon the world.

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| was saying that if Fenn were to attack, there would be trouble depending on the outcome.

Even though he was under the control of the Ultimate Dominion, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s thoughts were free. It would be different if he were under a stronger control, but he could still say what he wanted.

Incidentally, the same was also true for Leon.

His actions were constrained, but his thoughts remained unchanged. That is why, even in the battle with Silvia, he was able to minimize the damage by not attacking extensively.

In addition to that, he had also sent signals with his eyes, but unfortunately Silvia did not understand them. It was not because Silvia was not perceptive enough, but because she had been very busy.

However, even if she had been able to understand the signals, the information would have been limited to “Leon still has free will,” so it wouldn’t have been very meaningful anyway…

In any case, at the moment, the Ultimate Dominion only restricted his actions, but still allowed him to think freely.

For {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|, however, this was more convenient.

He couldn’t have a strategy meeting without flexible thinking, so {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s comment was welcome.

“That’s a good point. So, what do you think we should do to alleviate this anxiety?”

“No, well, I don’t know…”

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s momentum dissipated as soon as he was asked the question.

He had been so surprised that he spoke up, but when he thought about it, it’s not like he’d be at a disadvantage. He was back to his normal self, wondering what he’d even gotten upset about.

“N-No…even if you ask me such a difficult question, well, it’s not like there’s a problem, right?”

At any rate, as safely as he could, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| tried to sit down as if his role was over.

But {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| would not allow it.

‘You were planning to do that all along,’ {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| thought. {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s prediction came true.

“No, don’t be shy. You won’t be able to have a turn, but if you want to see how strong I am, I won’t stop you.”

He wasn’t planning to do that anyway, but now it was too late. {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| gave up and nodded reluctantly.

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s companions were furious, but {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| ignored them. He figured out that they were probably slacking off anyway, and forcibly involved them to distribute the work.

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| had no objection to this and approved it.

It was true that he trusted Fenn, but {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| was also a powerful man. *

The meeting seemed to be ending, but instead of that, everyone moved on to the next topic.

“Now, let’s determine the next attack point.”

“Ah. We’re planning a simultaneous invasion, taking full advantage of the aggressor’s capabilities. Rather, with all due respect to Fenn, you are the decoy.”

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| was not interested in the mission, but he wanted to ask. He thought it might make himself feel a little better if the other locations sounded more difficult.

That was the answer.

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| wondered what the purpose was.

It must have been something ridiculous, like bringing back Veldanava. Of course, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| would be happy if Veldanava was revived—

Doesn’t Veldanava-sama have his own reasons? Maybe {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| became too much trouble for him, or maybe he wanted to back off until the humans had matured.

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| thought that it would be more ignorant for them to make selfish assumptions about Veldanava, the creator and transcendent being.

Those who speak for the god are the most troublesome. They can distort your opinion without your permission when you openly state a different interpretation. It seems that {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| had a difficult time with this, and that’s why she said she stopped appointing humans as the Pope…

Even if they hear the exact same words, there are differences in the perceptions of those who receive them. Because people believe only what they want to believe, they are reluctant to admit when they are wrong.

As an actual example, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| had never said that she was the “one and only God.” Yet, for some reason, her followers had come to believe that {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| was the only god. It seemed that this was more convenient for {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|, so she did not deny it, but the fact that the truth changed when people intervened in the interpretation of the truth was troublesome if it was handled in the wrong way.

After observing the human world for a long time, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| had come to understand this. And yet, his colleague was setting a bad example, and he felt like giving them a break.

“Only the Veldora factor remains as a necessary element to revive Veldanava-sama. But there’s one more obstacle we mustn’t forget. Isn’t that right?”

Is that so?—{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| wasn’t involved.

And yet, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s eyes were on {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|.

Whoa, whoa, whoa, it’s me?! Give that to someone else!!

As he looked around, he saw that everyone had kept a serious, blank expression on their faces.

Zalario seemed to be holding on to the fact that he was dominated and was ready to ignore {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| completely.

Leon had just arrived and did not seem to be following the conversation, nor did he seem interested in it in the first place.

The same went for Fenn and Jahil. Fenn and Jahil did not know the answer to the question, because it was still new to them.

Pico and Gracia didn’t seem to know either. They were hiding behind {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|, looking down for good luck.

The other members of the “Seven Angels” were not {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s friends, but useful pawns. They were not the ones he wanted to ask for opinions, and {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| was the one who had to deal with them.

Is this a joke?! Because {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| and {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| are gone, I’m being put in charge of the thinking?!

That should have been Zalario’s job. {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| finally realized that he had unwittingly drawn the short straw.

He smiled and replied in a suggestive manner.

I knew it. He’s too smart for his own good and doesn’t want the others’ opinions. I thought I could make a conversation with him if I just praised him!

He knew that the logic was warped, but he wasn’t so good-natured as to point it out here, so he was inclined to let people do as they pleased.

The others were similar, and none of them expressed their opinions.

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| continued his explanation.

This was the {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| Velzard’s cognitive ability, equal to or greater than Milim’s ‘Milim Eye.’ She had no trouble detecting the presence of her siblings, let alone other people.

Following the west end ruled by {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|, the central west area ruled by {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| changed from a white light to a red light.

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| pointed to the red light.

“This means that {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| is here, in {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|. This was not a question, but an order. He was only saying that to lift Vega’s spirits a little.

Vega, being a simpleton, did not see it that way.

He grinned and nodded happily.

“Leave it to me. It’s a former home, with many hidden passages that no one knows about. I’ll sneak in and take care of this {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| kid.”

‘Hm,’ {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| nodded.

He had planned to let Vega run amok as a diversion and have Arios kill {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| while he was at it, but he wondered if that was possible.

Either way, he intended to go to {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s capital himself. Therefore, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| decided to let Vega do as he pleased and watch the enemy’s movements.

Of course, that was not all.

“Zalario, you are to lead the entire army to our support. Find out what {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| is up to, and if she moves, stop her.”

“And if she doesn’t?”

“Stand by. If I give the order, launch an all-out assault on {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s capital.”

“Understood.”

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s orders were absolute.

Zalario nodded meekly, keeping his frustrations to himself.

Currently, Jahil was the only one who hadn’t been ordered to do anything yet. There was no way {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| was going to leave his “Three Star Commander” force idle, so Jahil waited for {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s words while preparing himself.

“Also, let’s be careful. Jahil, you’re the support. I’ll leave you in charge of my subordinates, and you’ll do what you can to help Fenn.”

“Whoa, whoa, isn’t that a bit much? I don’t think that’s necessary.”

“Don’t say that Fenn. It’s just a precaution. Once you take control of {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|, you’ll have an army of your own, right?”

“I guess.”

“But as long as {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| is alive and well, there will be times when the Titan’s army will get in the way.”

“And it’s my job to stop them?’

“Yes, it is.”

Fenn boasted that it was unnecessary, but {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| was correct in this case. As for Jahil, it didn’t matter to him either way.

If Fenn is active, he can just watch him, and if he is in danger, he can sell him a favor.

Besides, he didn’t even need to be in a hurry to succeed, because the opportunity to play an active role would eventually come.

“Hmph! It’s a shame that they’re not the ones I trained, but it can’t be helped. As soon as I see Fenn’s victory, I’ll attack from the west to the center, do you mind?”

“Sure, do as you like.”

As soon as he heard that, Jahil went silent, implying that the conversation was over.

Jahil was an ambitious man. He owed a debt of gratitude to {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|, even if it meant doing his bidding. Considering the difference in strength, he thought it would be wise to follow him for the time being.

Incidentally, Velzard reported directly to Michael, so {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| had no authority to give her orders. The current policy was for {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| to let her do as she pleased.

In this way, everyone’s roles were defined.

*

Once the plan was settled, Michael spoke up.

“I have one more thing to say. Regarding the labyrinth in the {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s domain, it is not a good place to be trapped. I think it would be better to lure them out, as {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| said. Therefore, I’ve decided to hand over {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| Milim’s sphere of influence, centered on the former {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|, to Zelanus. As for the capital of {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| and the territories of Milim, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| will not be able to ignore any war that breaks out in his land. Be sure to defeat the reinforcements that he will send. If we do, our victory will be unquestionable.”

Michael’s words were full of conviction.

In fact, that was the greatest advantage for the aggressors. The destruction of the enemy’s forces through individual assaults. Repeatedly doing so would guarantee victory.

In addition, once the bases other than the capital “{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|” were eradicated, the siege formation would be complete. There were many mysteries in Ramiris’ labyrinth, and it was possible that there was more than one way in and out, but being able to stop the operations was significant.

It may be possible to bring in strategic supplies, but once separated from the world, it would be easy to reduce their influence.

However, since the ultimate goal was to capture Veldora’s dragon factor, they couldn’t simply wait and see.

That being the case, Michael decided that it would be best to bring the situation to that point and then slowly devise a strategy.

This may have been the right strategy, but {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| was not convinced.

“Whoa, whoa, Milim is the daughter of Veldanava-sama, you know? Do you understand that?”

He complained, as if expressing his indignation.

But Michael remained aloof.

“—Are there any problems?”

He asked {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|, his cool expression still intact.

“Are there any problems? No, no, I’m just wondering if it’s going to result in Veldanava-sama’s displeasure…”

That was a natural question from {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s point of view.

It would be an act of betrayal to Veldanava to touch Milim. So, what was Michael thinking?

However, Michael’s reaction was very calm, and he seemed to think that there was no problem at all. The same was true of {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|.

“{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|, I am aware. {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| Milim is the daughter of Veldanava-sama, however, she is no different from us in that she was created by him.”

There was doubt of that being Michael and {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s true thoughts. Their respect and loyalty seemed to be directed only to Veldanava, with not even a shred of affection for his daughter.

Jahil seemed to agree, sniffing and scowling at {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| with a mocking gaze.

Having been destroyed by Milim’s wrath in the past, he was feeling a sense of pleasure at the {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| invasion operation. {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s opinion, which might interfere with it, was not interesting to Jahil either.

Hey now, this is why Obera betrayed us! They really have a bad way of thinking…

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| thought to himself as he looked back at {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|.

If he didn’t do something, he would be branded a traitor.

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| spoke to {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|.

“Don’t worry, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|. If my actions are wrong, then he will come back to correct them. If his beloved daughter is in danger, he will surely come to her aid. That is why my action are correct.”

Now that he had said that, there was nothing left for {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| to say.

His old friend was dead. If only he had realized this sooner, he would have been able to escape—{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| regretted it even now.

And so, the outline of the Tenma Great War was decided and carried out.

And on that day—

The world was thrown into a whirlpool of chaos by a great calamity that would drastically change the course of the world.

  1. Chapter 2
    The Beginning of the Great War

After the discussion that night, it was decided that {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| and {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| would remain in my country’s custody.

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| was still unconscious, and it was safer to take care of her in the labyrinth. We could get detailed information and find out if there was any malicious intent at work.

So, it was only natural that {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| would come with me. I accepted the two of them without any complaint.

Silvia-san returned to {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|.

She would’ve been a great help as a warrior, but what was most important to Silvia-san was {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|, where her daughter was. I couldn’t just force her to do anything I wanted, so we promised to cooperate with each other if anything happened.

I also gave her a cell phone, just in case. El-tan had one, but I decided that it would be better for Silvia-san to have one as a backup.

The communication function of the {:this.app.capitalCase(this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term], true):}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s Ring was not universal, and it was best to have as many means of communication as possible.

After this trouble was all over, we could use them for fun.

After exchanging our contact information, I saw Silvia-san off.

And now, I was in my office.

There was so much paperwork that I almost felt as if my daily life had returned to normal.

Just by looking at them, my anger towards {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| seemed to increase by about 30 percent.

Look, I wasn’t just playing around either. And yet, there were piles upon piles of proposals that needed my approval, and a mountain of meeting notes for various measures that were being taken.

For the time being, I was putting off the meeting notes. I didn’t need to rush to look at them because they had already been done.

I looked through the new projects that needed approval and quickly decided whether they were acceptable or not.

I was busy, but it couldn’t be helped.

After all, the day after tomorrow, the world conference would be held in Kingdom of {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|.

That’s right, a world conference.

This would be the first such event in history.

The participation of the Emperor of the Eastern Empire in the Western States Council, which was regularly held in the West, was an unprecedented event.

Actually, I was supposed to meet up with {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| in the Kingdom of Blumund and go with him. But then some idiot decided to invade Leon’s country, and that’s why our plans were thrown off.

It was a mistake that I was now forced to fill in the gaps with these documents.

But that was all over now.

All I had to do now was to sip some tea and relax.

I would try to calm down and collect my thoughts before the show.

“{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|-sama, here’s your tea.”

It was {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|, not {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|, who brought me the tea. He was working hard as a secretary, probably because {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| was away.

“Thank you. You should take a break with me, too.”

I said as such, encouraging {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| to sit face-to-face.

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| was thrilled and looked at me to say something like, “I’m honored,” but I ignored it and started talking.

“So, what kind of guy is {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|, from your point of view?”

From my point of view, he seemed to be surprisingly unpopular.

If he wasn’t, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| wouldn’t have betrayed him so easily.

Anyway, what I needed now was information about the enemy.

If you know what kind of character they have, you will be able to judge to what extent they can bluff or not in case of emergency.

I understood well enough that he was cautious, so I thought I would ask if there was anything else.

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| thought for a moment and then answered.

“He’s a serious guy. He is hard-headed, inflexible, or whatever you wish to call it, but once he has made up his mind, he will not ben his will. He has a personality that doesn’t consider other people’s opinions even as a reference, so his peers were divided in their evaluation of him.”

In other words, for a yes-man, he is an easy boss because they only have to do what they are ordered to do, and for a talented and creative person, he is an uninteresting boss who ignores their own opinions.

It can be very stressful if your opinion is not accepted. If there is a good reason that is explained to you, you will be satisfied, but if there is just a rejection, you might be left with a grudge.

“Is there anything else?”

When I asked, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| began to worry, muttering, “That’s right…”

Then he responded with an “I’m not certain about this,” and went on to tell me something more important than I had expected.

To put it simply, it was about how to get to and from their base and this world.

They—the Aggressors, were the altered versions of those banished from this world by Veldanava and the angel legions that were their watchers.

Their base, of course, was in the Otherworld.

The connection between the Otherworld and this place, the Cardinal World, was a special force field called the “Underworld Gate,” and there were several of them around the world.

They were guarded, or rather controlled, by the {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|. Surprisingly, they were expanding their sphere of influence around the “Underworld Gate.”

The only one known to exist was the “Underworld Gate” guarded by {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|, not too far from Leon’s territory.

The other gates guarded by {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| and {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| had disappeared due to a major battle.

“We’re better off without them. If you go to the Otherworld with your body, it will be contaminated and transformed. Those who come here from the other side are almost certainly Aggressors.”

He told me bitterly.

In short, it would be easier to destroy the “gate” itself since it only brought chaos in this world.

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| and {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| didn’t approve of that. They had been guarding the gate for a long time, but when {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| went to scout for them, the gate was broken, so they had been easy to recruit.

I thought to myself, “That can’t be true, right?” but I didn’t say it. As proof, the gate that {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| had guarded appeared to be broken.

At present, it seemed that the gates had been left unattended because one could not come and go without great power.

I secretly thought that the correct answer was that it was broken on purpose.

But back to the main topic, what {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| was wondering about was how {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| and the others had come to this world.

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| speculated that perhaps a new “gate” had appeared somewhere in the Empire.

“Or maybe they’ve restored the gate that {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| used to guard?”

“I cannot deny that possibility. However, it doesn’t match the time when {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| appeared in the Empire, so it is certain that another “gate” exists.”

Well, that made sense.

“So then, you’re assuming that the Aggressor’s base is inside the Empire, right?”

So, I confirmed as such, but {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s concern was something else entirely.

“No, that’s not all. From what I heard of {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s story, there is no doubt that {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| has opened the gates to the Heavenly Star Palace. One would need a “key” to open it—”

The “Heavenly Star Palace,” also known as the place of beginnings, and the birthplace of Veldanava, I believe. As {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| had explained, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s base was adjacent to every world.

In other words, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s concern was about how to get the key—

“There is no point in worrying about how they got it. What matters is that if you pass through the gates of the Heavenly Star Palace, you can come to the Cardinal World with the body that exists in the Otherworld.”

Oops, I’m glad that I didn’t put that into words because it was way off.

Even so, what did he mean by the body that exists in the Otherworld?

“Of the Primordials, only {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| was given a body by Veldanava-sama. The current one is only inhabiting a temporary body, so there is no point in killing it.”

“Is this something like Velgrynd’s ‘Parallel Existence?’”

“No, it’s different from that. It’s not like they are connected all the time, but rather they’re splitting their consciousnesses. He’s probably synchronizing his memories periodically, so there are no inconveniences…”

That’s why it was so troublesome, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| explained to me.

From what I could understand, Velgrynd was like a set of synchronized computers connected to the internet, and {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| was like a set of computers disconnected from the internet, with only the data being transferred from the terminals.

«That seems to be the correct understanding. In other words, ‘Spacetime Continuous Attack’ will not be able to reach the main body, so he is a very troublesome opponent.»

I see, very troublesome.

“So then, unless we go to the place where the main body is to defeat {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|, you can’t defeat him. It’s certainly troublesome…but, huh? If the main body is going to go out of its way, isn’t that convenient for us?”

Rather than searching for someone we don’t know where he is, it would save us a lot of trouble if he came to us. That’s what I thought, but it seems that it was not that simple.

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| answered.

“Yes. However, he is simply quite strong. It’s possible that his main body’s fighting ability could surpass that of {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s. That is why I wondered if we needed to be prepared for any eventuality.”

The body Veldanava had given him was a treasure to {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|. That’s why {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| was always inhabiting a temporary body to avoid damaging it. But we also had to consider the possibility of him reversing that belief.

I think that was correct.

The situation should not be turned upside down by a single idea from the other party. And even more so when it was a force that couldn’t be ignored.

“A serious {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| is on par with Velzard-san. That means that {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| is also comparable to a True Dragon, right?”

“{:this.app.capitalCase(this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term], true):}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|, that is correct.”

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| says that {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| was pretty bad back in the day. Compared to the “Insect Lord” Zelanus, and the “World-destroying Dragon” Ivarage, he was a bit of a letdown, but in reality, that wasn’t really the case.

Even the existence value measured in the labyrinth was not accurate if it was not the main body. So, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s true power was unknown…

“I’ll leave it to you, but you’ll be okay, right?”

I planned to leave {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| to {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|. I was surprised to hear that {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s true strength was that of a True Dragon, but I knew {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| would be able to handle—No, isn’t it impossible as expected?

But as soon as {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| heard my words, he replied with a big smile on his face.

“I am deeply moved, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|-sama. I will continue to strive to live up to your trust!”

Oh, this, it looks like it’s okay.

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| may be overconfident, but he does not take on things he cannot do. He may or may not be able to win, but he seems to think it’s possible to deal with {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|.

If so, it would be foolish for me to worry about it.

It is always better to have a trusted subordinate fight against an opponent who’s fight may turn out to be an indefinite battle. So, I decided to let {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| to do his best, as I had originally planned.

Now that I understood how bad {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| was, I was curious about the next target.

“How do you think he’ll make his move?”

“Hmm, that’s right…it’s hard to predict, but based on {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s personality, I’d say he’s most likely planning to go after {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|-dono.”

“Eh?”

The unexpected answer took me by surprise.

But it was certainly an opinion I could not ignore.

I thought there was no point in going after {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|, but then I reconsidered the possibility.

Why was {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| targeted in the first place?

They had probably suspected that he was the reincarnation of Rudra and wanted to kill him. And this was proven by the fact that Velgrynd loves {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|.

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| was probably more wary of Rudra than {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|.
