Gracia asked.

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| responded with a smile.

“Well, it’s not an issue. As for me, as far as I’m concerned, you guys are just the right amount to get used to.”

“Hm, hmm…we’ve been taken as fools…”

“I’m pissed off too. I won’t forgive you even if you cry!”

Unlike with {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| and {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|, the conflict here was quite serious.

Rather, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| was even enjoying the situation.

She had assessed Pico and Gracia’s fighting ability and concluded that they were weaker than her.

She was right.

Pico and Gracia were not weak, and were of course million-class, but their existence values were around 2 million, a step below {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|.

On top of that, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| had the rare experience of having fought to the death against a competitor of equal ability (Damrada). “If I hit you, maybe you’ll get your free will back, so I’ll cooperate with you.”

“That’s the kind of thing that never works.”

“Yeah, that’s right. It’s none of your business!”

While exchanging such casual remarks, the head-on collision began.

*

The battle between {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| and Fenn was, to the casual observer, extremely intense.

But in reality, neither of them was serious. If they had been, everyone in the area would have been put under the pressure of their fighting spirit, and some of them might not have been able to even stand.

At the very least, it would have been less of a battle.

But the time for observation would soon be over.

The other groups did not want to fight in the small building and moved to their own battlefields.

As a result, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| and Fenn were the only ones left in the multi-storied Heaven’s Tower.

“It’s been a while since I’ve been this heated. Brother, I’m about to get serious.”

“Hmph! That’s what I want.”

Fenn’s fighting spirit swelled.

His power, rivaling that of the True Dragon, exerted a visible pressure on {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|.

However, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| was not to be defeated either.

“Nnngh!”

And, by letting his own fighting aura permeate his body, he transformed his muscles into something specialized for combat.

This was the start of a full-scale battle between the two brothers, and each of their goals was non-negotiable.

Fenn wanted the {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| of his rampaging days back.

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|, on the other hand, was seeking stability and order. He was willing to go to war if necessary, but he was not willing to go to war in vain.

They had incompatible goals. However, the winner of this fight would be able to make his opponent follow their wishes.

Because—

The battle would intensify.

And so, little by little, Fenn gradually began to gain the upper hand in what had been a tight competition.

The difference in strength was apparent.

In addition to that, the decisive factor was the Gleipnir, a chain that Fenn could control at will.

Veldanava had created it with his own hands, and it was an indestructible chain that boasted strength and flexibility above even the mythical-grade. Fenn had been bound by it for so many years that he had come to be able to control Gleipnir as if it were a part of his own body.

“Kuh, you’re so cocky…you’ve gained even more strength than before to have pushed me so far like this—Eh?!”

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| was caught off guard and had his hands and feet twisted together by Gleipnir.

He had an expression of anguish on his face.

Fenn smirked.

“Brother—you’d better accept the memories of the pain I deeply experienced!!”

And with that, he delivered a powerful headbutt.

A moment later, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| and Fenn’s souls touched, and their memories and emotions crossed.

What resulted from this was the sharing of memories.

As a result—

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| remembered.

“Do you remember now, Brother?”

“Hmph, I feel like I’m awake.”

“I see, well that’s good.”

Fenn’s smile deepened.

“Of course! As expected of Brother, that’s what I’m talking about!”

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| shouted, and Fenn smiled happily.

The member of the Octagram, and the giant {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| who guarded the Heaven’s Tower, was no more.

The ancient evil deity had returned.

*

Under {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s command, the Giant warriors had all been summoned.

The Titan Army was renamed the “Binding Chain Titans.” And they began their march into the barren desert to recreate the tyranny of ancient times.

It was not an orderly movement at all.

Each of them took their own weapons as they saw fit and acted in accordance with the orders of the king, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|. Even Glassord, who had been in league with Leon, was no exception.

“Hmm, it seems that the reason for hostility has disappeared. From now on, I will be your comrade in battle.”

Leon dealt with this unperturbed. It had been the expected conclusion if Fenn won.

She was tempted to complain.

After all, the number of allies had decreased, and the number of enemies had increased.

Even {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|, who had fought evenly against {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|, could not hide his impatience.

Leon, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|, Pico, and Gracia.

***

I took {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| and {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| to the “Holy Void” Damargania.

Leon seemed to be aware of my intentions. The fact that he wasn’t showing any signs of opposition was proof that Michael’s control was not at the brainwashing level.

And then, immediately, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|-sensei performed a forced ‘Skill Alteration’ on him.

That was how Leon—

“Sigh—even if it were part of the plan, I never want to do that again.”

—Well, he was successfully recovered.

Thus, Leon had returned as one of us.

The next target was the languid {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|.

His resistance would probably be small, since he showed no motivation to begin with.

‘I had put it off, thinking it would be easy to bring him back to his senses, but let’s just finish it all at once’—That’s what I thought, but it seems that it was a naive idea.

I felt a strong presence.

It was an oppressing feeling, as if a True Dragon was getting serious.

“Leon has been returned to us.”

“I don’t care about that. Leon’s Skill, the ‘Purity King (Metatron),’ is already in my hands, and he himself was merely the bait.”

“Bait…?”

«As I thought, it’s a “double check.” It seems that he was thinking of the same move as us, to the point of being brilliant.»

Uhh, dou-ble-che-ck…a double check?!

Then, in this case—

«Leon is the bait, and the likely target is—»

It’s {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|!

«…That’s correct.»

I’ve been beaten.

He dangled Leon in front of me as the bait and let me weigh it against {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| as the king. And then, I was caught brilliantly.

I understood that {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| was important to the enemy, but I hadn’t expected him to be so obsessed. Still, if I couldn’t be contained here, Michael’s plan would have failed…

“Isn’t it too early to feel like you’ve won?”

“Is it? I don’t think you guys will have a chance as soon as I get there.”

How confident.

Even though {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| and the others were still with the enemy, I could free them from his control. I was surprised he was so confident while knowing that.

Or perhaps, did he have some other plan to win?

“Hmph, your expression is saying that you think I’m up to something. Rest assured. You are nothing to me. I went along with {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| because he was a worrier, but I should have done this from the start.”

Wah?

I don’t understand.

Faced with a completely abnormal situation, Leon readied his sword—and collapsed.

Are you kidding me?

I have no idea what’s going on.

«No way…»

‘No way,’ huh?

Leon as well.

“{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|, take those lying over there and get away from here.”

“B-But—?!”

“It’s okay. I’ve got an idea!”

I didn’t have one.

“K-{:this.app.capitalCase(this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term], true):}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|. Please wait, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|-sama. I can still fight.”

Oh, so {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| is okay after all.

“Hmm, I had the feeling he wasn’t dead, but I guess I should’ve taken care of him.”

Seeing {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| on his feet did not dampen Michael’s spirits. He appeared to be absolutely confident that he could beat him as many times as he wanted.

I thought to myself,

‘This is a serious problem.’

“Okay, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|. Retreat. Take Leon with you and get going.”

“But!”

“That’s an order. There’s no way to win, so the best thing to do is escape.”

As I said that, I drew my sword and readied it.

I knew that Michael wouldn’t let me go since he was after me. So, the best thing to do was to use myself as bait and let the others escape.

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|, of course, understood this. Even so, he seemed quite conflicted, but the word “order” appeared to have worked. He teamed up with {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| and retrieved {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| and Leon. Then they retreated.

“Hmm, I thought you were going to interfere.”

“I have no interest in small fry.”

Wow, it’s a good thing {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| wasn’t listening.

That’s a line that would put him straight on the must-kill list, right?

He’s vindictive, so he would definitely achieve it one day. That’s what made him such a dangerous guy.

Even so, on my own, it was one against four.

Michael alone would have been hopeless, but now I was good as dead.

Well, worst-case scenario, Veldora was still here, so I think I could be revived, but the thought of actually testing it still felt bad.

Would the resurrected me really be the same as the current me? That was the question that came to mind. That’s why I didn’t like the idea of Veldora dying either…

As I was thinking about this, Michael made a move.

“{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|, leave this place to me, you guys should return as well.”

Oh, thankfully, he seems to want a one-on-one duel. Well, he might have found out that I was planning to free {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| and the others when I had the chance, but I knew the odds of that succeeding were slim, so it was definitely not a bad deal for me.

“Eh, is that okay?”

“It doesn’t matter. If I have complete control over his mind, I won’t be able to move as flexibly, and in his current state, he’ll cut corners, won’t he? I can’t use a pawn like that.”

Oh, I see. He knew that {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| and Leon weren’t really following him.

So then, does that mean that Michael has completely beaten us to the punch this time?

«……»

No, it’s okay.

Even {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|-san makes mistakes, too.

«No. This is also part of the plan.»

Once again, you should be generous about your defeats.

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|-san’s hating to lose was also a problem.

Well, I guess I’ll stop talking so casually and do my best to not make things worse.

Now that I knew I was going to lose, I felt much better.

I didn’t want to be seen in a bad light, but now that {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| and the others were gone, it was fine.

The only thing left to do was to give it my best.

I prepared myself and began observing Michael. I could sense that his presence was much stronger than when I had met him before.

Is it several times greater than mine?

«We aren’t in the labyrinth, so it can’t be measured exactly, but I’m pretty sure the value is over 100 million.»

We can’t win like that!

Even if the difference was more than double, it would be unreasonable, but a difference of more than 10 times was just too much.

«No, it’s okay. It is the power output that matters, so the outcome cannot be decided by the amount of energy alone.»

So, it’s all about fighting spirit. Is it will-power?

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|-san was bad at giving up, but it had a point.

If you give up before the fight ends, your chances of winning become zero, but if you at least try, you might be able to unexpectedly get by.

The problem, however, was Michael’s mysterious attack that had even defeated {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|.

I had no idea what he did, but somehow, I felt a vague sense of déjà vu.

That’s right, that was—

«Yes, it was a familiar phenomenon. That sensation…I am almost ready to understand it—»

Oh, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|-san is very dependable after all. So, then it was expected that Michael would launch that attack?

«No. Regarding that matter, it was a complete miscalculation.»

I-I see.

Well, it can’t be helped.

It’s impossible to perfectly predict an enemy’s moves, and we can also use this opportunity to uncover the mystery that would lead to the next victory.

In that sense, this defeat is also—well, I haven’t lost yet.

I’m worried whether I’ll actually be able to be revived, so let’s give it our best shot.

While I was thinking about this, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| and his friends had left.

Only Michael and I remained here.

Here, in the hall of Heaven’s Tower, the battle between Michael and I was about to begin.

***

After seeing {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| off, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| tried to grasp the current situation.

The Capitol building where the world conference was being held also had conference rooms and guest rooms on other floors. She rented one of these rooms as a temporary command center and began to compile reports from her subordinates.

Once she grasped the situation, she let out a sigh as her head began to hurt.

“What the hell is going on…”

She couldn’t help muttering to herself.

The Capitol was fully guarded to protect the safety of the dignitaries from various countries. Not only the {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|, but also knights and temporarily recruited adventurers from various countries were on guard duty.

If the Capitol were to fall, the chain of command would be disrupted, and so the refugees would be received elsewhere.

The main hall of the Holy Church in the Kingdom of {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| was also opened to receive refugees, and there were plenty of refugee centers throughout the capital.

This was because the city had always been prepared for the Tenma Great War, which was said to occur every 500 years or so.

This was the case in not only the Kingdom of {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|, but in the Western Nations as well. People were provided with shelters in underground bunkers and caves in the nearby mountainsides. This was also the reason why they could sufficiently cope with the thorough evacuation, which was also on the agenda this time.

Regarding the current terrorist acts in the capital, they made sure to mitigate the human damage by evacuating the residents to such facilities. The purpose of this was to prevent major confusion from occurring and to prepare an environment in which they could concentrate on dealing with the enemy.

As of now, the results of the daily training had been demonstrated and the people were successfully led away. The evacuation was complete, and the people who escaped were now calm.

However, this was not a solution to the problem.

This time, it was not a natural disaster, but rather the people who caused the disturbance.

According to reports, explosions were happening all over the capital, and they were turning into fires. The cause of the fires was said to be majins of Special A rank and above.

The {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| had been mobilized for this event, as it was a gathering of dignitaries from various countries. Fortunately, the “Holy Knights” who were on guard duty were able to handle the situation, but the situation was not good.

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| was disgusted, but due to her position, she was not allowed to show even a hint of her true emotions on her face. It would only increase the anxiety of her subordinates and create unnecessary work for her.

Moreover, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| deeply understood that she should not become emotional in front of the evacuees.

It would be a problem to further upset people who were already worried.

So Hinata did not waver.

All {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| could do now was reduce the anxiety of the evacuees and prevent further chaos, even if only a little.

Fortunately, the facilities were comfortable and there was a stockpile of food.

At any rate, the right thing to do for now was to deal with the enemy without worrying the evacuees.

“I’ll leave this to you. Have at least one {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| stay at each shelter. Have the Templar Knights help as well.”

“““Yes!””””

The enemy wasn’t just on the outside.

The evacuees could also turn into a mob at any moment.

Things were still calm now, but there was no telling what would happen if it took too long to eliminate the enemy.

Those confused by fear, and those who screamed and rioted from anxiety—It was expected that the number of such people would increase as time went on.

It all depended on the future situation, but in the worst case, it might be necessary to devote troops to suppress the riots.

With that in mind, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| swallowed a melancholy sigh.

A short time had passed since the explosion had occurred.

Now, at last, the full extent of the enemy could be seen.

“A riot of the death penalty prisoners?”

“Yes. Moreover, the enemy has freed Prince {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|, who was under house arrest in the north tower of the castle and has made him their flagbearer!”

“Prince {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|—I see, that man hasn’t shown any remorse at all.”

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| was in the process of being re-educated due to his blunder at the council. He was on the verge of being deprived of his right to the throne, but {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| and King Aegil of {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|, who didn’t want to make things worse, agreed that he would be reduced to the first degree of guilt as he was only being used at the time.

Still, it was a disgrace to the royal family, and for the past year he had been under house arrest in the north tower of the castle…but it seems that he had fallen into the hands of the enemy.

To make matters worse, he seemed to be voluntarily cooperating with them.

Not only that, but {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| and the others were accusing {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| by name.

“My dear people! I have been deceived by a witch! She has framed me and ruined my standing in the council. And now she wants to murder my father and bring chaos and misery to this land. Do not be fooled! She is trying to take away your freedom on the pretext of evacuating you! I trust that my dear and wise people will understand whose words are correct!”

—Said Prince {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|, who was apparently making a speech in the city’s main square.

“Is that true?”

“I heard it with my own ears.”

“Can you corroborate?”

“I can’t get into the royal castle at the moment. I am checking it via {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s followers, but they seem to be quite confused…”

“Then there’s a good chance that King Aegil has been killed. What a terrible thing…”

It was a headache of a problem.

Although she had expected a mob to be incited, she hadn’t expected someone to make the worst choice at the worst time.

To make matters worse, it was the royal family of the Kingdom of {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| who were the cause of {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s troubles.

Prince {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| had caused problems, but the details of those problems had not been made public. That was an issue, and it only complicated the situation.

He was using his position as a member of the royal family to the fullest to mobilize the power of the state.

Even {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| had not expected to see such a disruption in cooperation with the parties during an emergency situation.

“Now then, what should we do?”

A white-haired beauty garbed in a military uniform appeared in front of {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| as she pondered this.

Leaning back on the sofa as gracefully, as if she were the owner of the room, the beautiful woman, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|, opened her mouth.

“I’ve gotten proof. {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| has confirmed with his own eyes that Aegil was murdered.”

“—In other words, the upper management of this country is unreliable. All hell is breaking loose, isn’t it?”

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| nodded with a laugh, saying that the castle was in a state of chaos.

“Yes. Going back and forth, the chain of command is in chaos.”

‘That’s right,’ {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| nodded in agreement.

“Well, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| has been ordered to protect the council chamber, so the safety of the dignitaries is guaranteed.”

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| assured her that he could at least buy them some time. This was a pretty high evaluation, and {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| was surprisingly well acknowledged.

“Well, that does offer a bit of relief.”

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| and {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| nodded at each other.

However, now things had become tricky.

Not only was there an unknown enemy, but there was also someone who wanted to harm {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|.

They seemed to be accusing {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| by name for being a witch who misled people, but this was difficult to deny.

It would not have been a problem if the enemy was just an ordinary person. If they were a nobleman, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s public power could have crushed him.

But this was the royal family of this country.

The biggest problem of all was that Prince {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| was very popular among the people.

Prince {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| was a handsome man with delicate manners, and he was popular among women. Regardless of his abilities, he was popular with the people because of his good-natured exterior.

His blunder in the council was not known to the people and was irrelevant.

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|, though well known, was shunned for her cold-heartedness. In terms of popularity, she was far behind Prince {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|.

Incidentally, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| herself was not aware of the fact that she had a huge following among some people with certain tastes. The group was quite gentlemanly, as they had the common sense to know that it would end once they were known.

All that aside, the problem now as about Prince {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|.

The subordinates were looking at {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| anxiously.

That was only natural.

Because the prince of this country was loudly denouncing {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| to fuel the people’s anxieties.

He was calling her a king-slayer, a witch enchanted by the {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|, and someone who would lead the people to ruin.

But even so, I can’t believe…I didn’t expect him to be such a fool…

Inwardly, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| cursed herself for being so careless.

She hadn’t seen Prince {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| for the fool he was.

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| had never expected that he would go to such horrible lengths to kill his father and usurp the throne.

Just then, there was a knock at the door and a knight entered the room.

It was Arnaud Bauman, one of the captains of the {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s trusted subordinate.

Arnaud reported as soon as he entered the room.

“Then it was {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| who murdered the king, wasn’t it?”

“I’m sure of it.”

“He’s been framed as the culprit, but I doubt he’ll have the chance to explain himself in court.”

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| let out a big sigh in thought.

“{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|, that fucking bastard. How dare he hold a grudge against {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|-sama just because he was beat up at the council meeting!”

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|, one of the captains waiting in the room, complained indignantly.

According to Arnaud’s explanation, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|, who had been intimidated by {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| at the council meeting and had made the mistake of being incarcerated, was eager to clear his name.

For this reason, he was planning to defeat {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| in public to clear his name.

It was a ridiculous story; a crime being committed out of personal resentment.

However, the root of the problem was deep.

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| took forceful measures to make up for his mistake. This was the common understanding of everyone, but there was no way to prove it.

The whole thing was a setup, and the evidence seemed to have been destroyed.

There was a way to get other countries’ representatives to testify, but that was only possible during peacetimes. In such a case of emergency, they could not endanger the senators, and the people would not believe anything {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| and the others had to say now anyway.

Unfortunately, Prince {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| was very popular in this country.

It was as clear as day who the people would believe.

“{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|-sama has never had a good reputation…”

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| quipped, and Arnaud gave a small nod of agreement.

Glaring at the two, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| changed the subject with a comment of her own.

“I guess we’re on the back burner.”

“But even so, I didn’t think he would kill his own father, the king. He seems to be trying to pin the blame on {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|-sama, but that’s just absurd.”

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s mutter was echoed by Arnaud.

The purpose of Prince {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| and {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| was obvious. They wanted to take advantage of the chaos and pretend that all their own blunders and sins had never happened.

Rather than taking revenge on {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|, they may be using this as a check against other nations.

They may be thinking that by defeating {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|, the strongest of the Western Nations, they would be able to shut down protests from other nations.

“But I don’t understand. I don’t think this {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| guy was good enough to assassinate the king.”

From {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s point of view, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| was not weak, but he was not strong either. He was the equivalent of an Over A rank adventurer.

A country as large as {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| should have several other knights who could rival {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|. The answer came from Cardinal {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|, who visited {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|.

“Apparently, the magical inquisitors have all been killed. We had information that they were conducting a suspicious experiment in the underground of this place, but it seems that the experimental entities have gone out of control.”

“{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|, huh?”

“I have come with a message from {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|-sama, but I decided to look into this while I was here.”

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| replied, competent as ever.

He was like a loyal dog who would do anything to be praised by {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|.

He was merciless to everyone other than {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|, but he was also very good at keeping up appearances. He maintained an expression of warmth and was well-liked by his followers.

However, for those who knew his true nature, he was not someone they wanted to have anything to do with. In fact, Arnaud and {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| kept a low profile, avoiding eye contact with {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|.

Ignoring these outsiders, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| began to brew a pot of tea. He was a very diligent man who also earned points in this way.

He prepared a cup of tea for {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| as well, and she looked satisfied when she took a sip of it. This was indicative of a very high score and proved that {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| was no ordinary person.

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| also sipped her tea and collected her thoughts.

“What if, rather than taking advantage of the chaos, this whole mess is just what {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| and the others want?”

“Eh? But those are {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| running rampant in the city, aren’t they?”

“That’s the first thing that’s strange. How could a {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| break into the royal capital that’s protected by the ‘city barriers’? To begin with, the strength of the {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| is also rubbish, isn’t it?”

The {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| reported were not in one, but rather several at the same time.

They were said to be rampaging all over the capital, but their purpose was unknown. They were said to be going around destroying anything and everything they could find.

Moreover, it seems that they had ‘Ultraspeed Regeneration,’ which allowed them to repair their wounds immediately.

The fighting ability was more than that of a {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|. Fortunately, they seemed to be of low intelligence, and the knights were currently preparing decoys to minimize the damage.

Judging that it would be dangerous to deal with them individually, the soldiers were ordered to stay behind for now. After considering how to deal with them, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| was scheduled to go into battle in the worst-case scenario, but now a problem had arisen that they had to worry about.

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| joined the conversation.

“On that note, it seems that some of my subordinates have been defeated. They were under strict orders to retreat before they died, so I didn’t get much information—”

She didn’t get much but would still disclose the information she had.

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s subordinates were the devil chevaliers. All of them are Special A rank, with existence values of over 100,000.

It was no surprise that the magical inquisitors were no match for such a group of devil chevaliers, who had chosen to retreat.

“Apparently, the experimental subjects were incarnated by angels.”

“What is that?”

“The ones that failed to incarnate are the {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| that are running rampant right now. And the ones who still have their egos intact—”

The enemy who had defeated the devil chevaliers—{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| was convinced that it was one of Michael’s men.

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|, the second-in-command, was in charge on the scene with {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| and {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| in tow.

Thanks to the training in the labyrinth, even the common Holy Knights who were not captains had grown into powerful warriors. In fact, the captains had become so strong that they were capable of defeating Clayman-like opponents on their own.

However, against an experiment of magical inquisitors fused with the power of angels, it would be dangerous to take them on head-on.

And with Michael’s shadow flickering in the background as {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s adversary, she decided that they shouldn’t get involved carelessly.

“{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|, you have a message from {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|, right?”

“That’s right. She says it’s not an urgent matter, but she can’t send reinforcements.”

“That means there are other enemies.”

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| would never abandon {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|.

Therefore, the fact that she could not send reinforcements meant that there was a high possibility of other threats lurking about.

“This is tough.”

That was the conclusion that {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| came to.

“I’d tell you to think for yourself a little, but we don’t have much time. If {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| was also on death row, it wouldn’t be strange if he was used as an experiment, right?”

“Ah!”

“I see, so it’s possible that he’s taken in the power of an angel…”

*

Now, that being the case, it was impossible for the {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| to deal with this matter alone. {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| asked, and {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| answered without hesitation.

Prince {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| claimed that {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| was a king-slayer. However, that would only be true in normal peacetimes.

The current situation in the royal capital was chaotic.

The people of {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|, accustomed to a world of peace, were in the midst of a catastrophe that had come out of the blue.

If {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| were to be killed here, all the claims about the real culprit would be accepted.

Everyone agreed with that.

“Exactly. Besides, let’s not forget that the true enemy is not here. What would happen if the army of angels were to attack, and the nation’s key figures were killed?”

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| muttered with a bitter expression on his face, as if he had been convinced.

In conclusion, there was no choice but to do as {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| said.

Based on her beliefs, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| set out to do what she could for now.

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| knew very well that this would in turn lead to trust in them.

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| said as such and declared that she would be {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s opponent.

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| nodded in agreement.

“I will go with you. Now, as for the {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|—”

“We do not need {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|-dono’s help. Please leave it to us!”

“If it’s a {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| without an ego and no intelligence, we can fight them. The light attribute is a bit of a problem, but we’ve been trained in the labyrinth, so we’ll show you what we can do!”

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| looked at the two of them with a frown.

Why are they so conscious of {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|-dono?

She was taken aback, thinking that they were trying to look good in front of a beautiful woman.

But the truth was something different.

Besides, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| had many sympathizers, not just in the labyrinth. This was how much {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s influence had increased, but {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| did not know that this was the case, having lost interest in politics.

For {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|, this was a very important time. Despite {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s orders to make the World Conference a success, she had allowed the enemy to invade.

On top of that, she was responsible for being unable to stop the destruction in the capital.

Giving priority to human life was no excuse for that.

Behind her smile, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| was burning with rage.

That was why she approved of Arnaud and the others’ suggestions.

“In that case, please do. I will lend you some of my subordinates and you can incorporate them into your unit.”

She told him as such and went on to help Arnaud and the others.

This was all in preparation for her own move.

She left the command to Arnaud and the others and gave them the task of restoring security to the capital. On top of that, she intended to strike the mastermind herself.

Thus, the division of roles was decided.

“Well then, let’s go now. We have to bring down the death penalty on those who have acted foolishly in this time of emergency.”

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| said coldly.

She was going to get rid of {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| here to clear her own name.

And she would capture {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| and make him confess to his crimes.

—is what {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| said.

This was a declaration that she would do exactly what the enemy was trying to do.

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| was a {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| who did not care about ethics, and she believed that as long as she was the winner, she could do whatever she wanted. It was a very {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|-like argument.

And so, well aware that it was a trap, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| and the others headed to the stage where the enemy was waiting for them.

*

Once they were outside of the Capitol, they found things in a terrible state.

Part of the royal castle in the center of the city had partially collapsed, spoiling its beautiful appearance.

The aristocratic district, where the Capitol and the branch of the Holy Church were located, was relatively better, but the downtown area facing the main street of the city was on fire.

“It can’t be helped that we prioritized evacuation, but this is going to be hard to clean up.”

“Full-scale battles are still to come, and there will be more damage. With the loss of the king and his successor, it will take time for {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| to recover.”

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| calmly responded to {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s murmur.

It was a cold reaction, unbecoming of a priest. But that was {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’ normal behavior.

For {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| was the only priority, and he did not care about anything else. It was because he wanted to be of service to {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| that he rose to the position of Cardinal, the highest rank next to the Pope.

It is because he was such a man that he was still accompanying {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| without regard for danger.

Incidentally, there were five of them now.

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|, and Cardinal {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|, who had followed {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| out of concern for her. These three were joined by {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| and {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| who had been summoned.

As they headed for their destination, they planned their strategy.

“{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|, you don’t have to fight, just go into ‘search mode’ and prepare for a surprise attack.”

“Understood!”

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| was a yes man.

He obeyed {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| without saying anything else.

Even so, he would sometimes say unnecessary things and get into trouble, but as he had been {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s second-in-command for a long time, he knew how to take care of himself.

This, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s ‘Search Mode,’ was a kind of ‘Barrier’ of sorts. He dispersed his own fragmented ‘Clone’ into a hemisphere of one kilometer in diameter. This allowed him to react immediately to a surprise attack from 500 meters away.

At first glance, this may not seem to be any different from ‘{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|,’ but that was not the case. That was because the speed of information transmission was much faster, and {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s own analytical ability was also added to deal with enemy attacks.

Moreover, five hundred meters was a perfect distance for {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|, whose ‘perceptual speed’ could be increased by a million times with her skill. Even if it was an attack at the speed of light, under the influence of {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s ‘Search Mode,’ there would be more than a second before the attack would hit the target and it would be possible to deal with it.

Of course, it was not possible to move at the speed of light, and this was merely extending the time being perceived, but {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| would still be able to manage.

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s ‘Search Mode’ seemed to be perfect, but it had only one drawback.

That was—

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| was in the most danger because he was the one who would take the first hit.

Even if I’m damaged by that surprise attack, I doubt she’ll care…

Although obedient, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| still complained inwardly.

Taking a glance at {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s ability, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| saw through its nature.

“You are still wary of surprise attacks. So then, you’re saying that the one making all the noise is a decoy?”

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| smiled when she pointed this out.

“That’s right. In the first place, we could narrow down the enemy’s objective when they targeted this conference.”

“To divide the West, or to aim directly at {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|. The biggest opportunity for them is {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| who has become the Emperor of the Eastern Empire, correct?”

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s grin deepened as {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| replied without a second thought.

“As expected of you, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|-dono. {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|-sama did approve of you.”

“The flattery is nice. I’m sure it would be obvious to anyone who saw it.”

“Not really, but that’s fine.”

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|, as usual, analyzed the enemy’s strength and searched for their weaknesses.

Apart from walking, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| smoothly moves sideways. {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| inwardly snapped.

Velgrynd turned to {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|, her eyes full of compassion.

Glenda Adley said as such.’

A number of prototype weapons had been secretly developed at Tempest and were never expected to see the light of day. The “Musketeer Corps,” led by Glenda, was the supplier of these weapons.

They were her prided subordinates, who had been secretly modified in the Empire. Their individual combat abilities were at least A rank, and they were skilled in the use of various weapons.

They had a variety of vicious weapons, such as small anti-tank guns (rocket launchers) and hand-held gatling guns. The ammunition used in these weapons was not ordinary but was a hazardous material that had been designated for use only by those with specialized knowledge. Its power could only be guessed at.

“““Yes!!”””

“Best of luck to you.”

“Hi-{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|-sama…is this okay? Why don’t you leave this to {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|-dono?”

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| asked, but {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| turned a deaf ear to his suggestion.

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|, who was horrified by {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’ words, was greatly relieved to learn that {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| had no intention of doing so. *

At the beginning of the battle, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| had been the main opponent of Arios.

The occasional glow was his proof that the battle was still going on. It was an impossible task for {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| to understand the battle with his eyes.

The speed was too fast to follow with his eyes, and it was impossible to understand what was going on. He was just pretending to be able to see.

—I mean, there’s nothing I can do about it.

Not wanting to get in the way, he left the fighting to the others.

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| now understood exactly what he was capable of. It was on the level of enlightenment, so his sense of fear was diminishing.

Even so, fear was still fear.

To distract himself from his fear, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| recalled a happy memory.

In this respect, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| was wonderful.

She was quite scary, but he was forgiven for something unavoidable.

With this, there was no need to worry anymore.

He could enjoy his happiness without worrying about the future.

Without even realizing it, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s happy mood had a tremendous impact on the scene.

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| attacked without hesitation, as if he were strolling along on a walk.

The claws on {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s hands turned jet-black and grew long. The surface of his claws vibrated finely with a technique that generated waves that could split all matter.

Clicking his tongue, Arios evaded. But it didn’t stop there.

“How naive.”

Leaving the mutter behind, Minits took aim at Arios, who had lost his stance. He tilted his body unnaturally, ignoring gravity and inertia, and rushed forward like a cannonball.

With his Unique Skill ‘Oppressor,’ he adjusted his trajectory to Arios, forming an obstacle-free path. He then compressed and exploded the air under his feet to gain thrust.

Minits reached his maximum speed in an instant and unleashed a barrage of blows that left Arios no time to react.

“You small fry, you’re getting carried away!”

Arios, who had been head-butted in the jaw and knee-kicked in the stomach, glared at Minits in fury.

But Arios could not afford to do so.

“Assassination is my specialty.”

A black flash of light ripped through Arios. {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|, who had been hiding in perfect cover, had aimed for the moment when Arios’s mind was turned to Minits.

Arios politely declared as he held two daggers in his hands. The mythical-grade two-sword style was Arios’ original style of melee combat.

Damn them…they’re only halfway competent, and yet they’re still getting in my way…

Arios was indignant.

“Well, yeah. I was hoping it would be a little more difficult, but I’ve been lucky again today.”

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| cheerfully incited Arios, who was filled with anger.

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| was not overconfident in his power.

—Although, it might take several hundred years to revive if I die. I seriously hope that doesn’t happen.

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s nerves sharpened as he thought about this.

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| used ‘cognitive inhibition’ to contain Arios’ power and keep the influence of ‘Punishment King Sandalphon’ small, though not completely.

The diminutive {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| activated her Skill the moment she was out of Arios’ sight. Then, when Arios was caught completely off guard, she unleashed a fatal blow.

Unfortunately, Arios was not weak enough to be defeated by such a blow, but even so, the damage was steadily accumulating.

Each player’s role had its own meaning, and {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s ‘Lucky Field’ was the perfect combo to make this happen.

Arios, who had underestimated his opponent’s superiority, found himself unknowingly in a tight spot.

It can’t be, I’m being pressured?!

While he was feeling disgusted, the situation was worsening in earnest.

He was at their mercy, unaware of this as time continued passing by.

*

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| was rolling on the ground, screaming.

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| was restraining them, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| was bringing them into a one-on-one situation, and {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| was supporting them.
